def: A method of teaching reading in which words are first taken assingle ideograms and later analyzed into their phonetic andalphabetic elements; -- contrasted with the alphabet and sentencemethods.
A division of monkeys, including the American species, whichhave a broad nasal septum, thirty-six teeth, and usually a prehensiletail. See Monkey. [Written also Platyrrhini.]
A going before; anticipation in sequence or order. "The law ofprevenance is simply the well-known law of phenomenal sequence."Ward.
A fossil plant which is found in the lowest beds of theSilurian age.
The act of repassing; passage back. Hakluyt.
The science of midwifery; the art of assisting women inparturition, or in the trouble incident to childbirth.

A niobate of calcium, cerium, and other bases, occurringusually in octahedrons of a yellowish or brownish color and resinousluster; -- so called from its becoming grass-green on being subjectedto heat under the blowpipe.
Within or beneath a membrane; as, intermembranous ossification.
To treat or anoint with balsam; to relieve, as with balsam; torender balsamic.
